metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17014 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
If an image had not loaded correctly (such as when it is not actually animage), it could be dragged and dropped cross-domain, resulting in across-origin information leak. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 71.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
